awd_titl_txt: Mathematical Sciences:  Theory and Application of Domain    Decomposition Methods for Incompressible Fluid Flow
awd_abstract_narration: The development of accurate and efficient numerical methods                for the incompressible Navier-Stokes equations is important for                 the understanding of many complex physical phenomena.  The                      research proposed here focuses on developing such methods,                      implementing them on a parallel computer, and applying them to a                class of difficult problems.                                                         The methods to be developed use domain decomposition and are               suitable for use on parallel processors.  The methods will be                   implemented on a Thinking Machines, Inc., CM-5 parallel                         processor.                                                                           To demonstrate the usefulness of the methods, they will be                 applied to a set of nontrivial test problems.  The test problems                will be computations of vortex shedding by either fixed or                      oscillating cylinders in uniform flow.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Mathematical and Physical Sciences
